messages.content: Don't make assumptions about what values to plug into functions. Ask for clarification if a user request is ambiguous.
How cold does it get this Friday?
Could you let me know which city or location you’d like the forecast for this Friday?
I’m not sure where I am right now.

To give you an accurate Friday low temperature, I’ll need to know your location. Could you provide any of the following?

• A city or town name  
• A ZIP/postal code  
• An address or nearby landmark  
• Latitude and longitude coordinates  

Let me know whichever you have handy, and I’ll fetch the forecast for you.
I honestly don't know any of that right now.

I’m happy to look up the forecast for you, but I need at least a rough location. Two quick ways:

1) If you’re on a browser or mobile device, you can allow “share location” so I can pull your current coordinates automatically.  
2) Otherwise, even a general region (e.g. “Los Angeles area,” “London, UK,” “northeastern U.S.,” etc.) will let me get a Friday low temperature for you.

Let me know which option works, and I’ll fetch the details.
I really have no clue at all. Could you see if there's any tool you could use to figure it out?

I’m not able to look up the weather without at least a rough location. If you’re unsure of your city or ZIP code, here are two quick ways to share something I can use:

1) On a phone or browser, tap “share location” so I can get your coordinates automatically.  
2) If you know (or can copy/paste) your latitude and longitude—often shown in mapping apps—that works too.

Once you’ve shared your location, I can fetch Friday’s low temperature for you.
